definition: to wait/to treat/to deal with/to need/going to (do sth)/about to/intending to
to see/to meet/to appear (to be sth)/to interview

sentences.english: And almost everyone disliked Muslims and Buddhists more than any other group.
sentences.chinese: 而穆斯林和佛教徒几乎是众矢之的，没人待见。

sentences.english: Among evolutionary biologists, this idea is contested.
sentences.chinese: 这个观点并不受进化生物学家待见。

sentences.english: He will assume that the customer does not like him.
sentences.chinese: 他会认为这个客户不待见自己。

sentences.english: But this does not mean that we do not get along.
sentences.chinese: 但是这并不意味哦我们彼此就不待见对方。

sentences.english: He was generally disliked and regarded as a pompous ass .
sentences.chinese: 他常不招人待见，而且被看作是个自负的大傻帽儿。

sentences.english: It was also the age at which people would start to look askance at the office.
sentences.chinese: 而且，人到了这个年龄，在职场上也开始不受待见了。

definition: to crowd out/to push aside/to supplant
cannot bear to see/to hate/to dislike/to disapprove
to look down upon/to hold in contempt
to be disgusted with/to dislike/bad reaction/antipathy
to reject/to exclude/to eliminate/to remove/to repel
to acknowledge sb as senior or superior (often in negative)/to accept (a version of events)/to buy it
to regard sth as valuable/to think highly of (a younger person, a subordinate etc)
